Osomatsu bit the inside of his cheek as he walked the streets. He was about to make a big change in his life - something he’d been avoiding for a long time now but couldn’t afford to ignore any longer if he wanted the rest of his brothers to continue to live happily.

He needed a job. Thing was, almost any job available required training in skills that he just didn’t have. The sad side effect of living for so long as a NEET. 

Thankfully, he’d found a flyer for a company that seemed to be just for this kind of problem. A NEET correctional facility that would train him and get him on the right path to be a functional member of society. He’d be able to get a job and start helping out more around the house. He’d also left the flyer on the table at home in case any of his younger siblings wanted to make the change as well.

Pushing the doors to the facility open as he arrives, Oso tries his best to look presentable - a calm and confident stride and a cheerful smile as he approaches the secretary at the front desk.

“Excuse me, I’m here to check in.” He announces, bowing slightly. “Osomatsu Matsuno, I’m supposed to be learning how to make chairs?”

At first glance, the NEET Correctional Facility seemed like a nice agency. With NEETs being at the bottom of the social and economic ladder, many held disdain for them, so a facility to help them get higher in the work force would be valuable.

However, the facility wasn't what it seemed to be. When a NEET signed up for the service, they would not receive any help for the real world. Instead, the facility was a furniture company that specialized in using humans for their furniture. If a NEET went missing, nobody would notice, so it seemed like a perfect coverup.

The secretary smiles sweetly at Oso, stepping out from behind the desk and motioning towards a door.

"Of course, right this way," she says, leading him into a small, dimly-lit room. Waiting for Oso is a chair, a big roll of duct tape, a large cloth, and a pair of scissors.

"Feel free to make yourself comfortable..." the secretary says, her voice growing seductive. "Won't you be a good boy and sit down in the chair? I'll explain the next few steps after you do."

Alright, first step, not so hard. Oso feels a rush of relief. Really the hardest thing so far was making the decision to try and better his life in the first place. Making chairs didn’t seem that bad either - it’d likely be difficult but seeing something that he’d made by himself would probably give him a sense of satisfaction.

He’s a little confused by the sparse contents of the room but he figures that it must be part of the initial training and initiation.

"Instead of building a chair, you /are/ the chair. You'll be wrapped up like this for the rest of your life, as a living piece of furniture. Isn't that great? A shitty NEET like you has a purpose now.

Three months pass. His master occasionally gives him attention, sometimes doesn't let him cum for weeks on end. And all the while, he wonders just how broken the little chair is, all isolated and wrapped up in his own little world.

The Matsuno household has been in complete disarray. When one of their own disappeared it went almost unnoticed for a week before any of the brothers mentioned that they hadn’t seen Oso back in the house. They aren’t worried at first but the more time that passes, the clearer it becomes that something must have happened to the eldest sextuplet.

They rifle through his things, trying to figure out where he’s gone and it’s Kara that discovers the flyer underneath a pile of mail that’s nearly three months old. As long as Oso’s been missing without any trace of where he’d gone to.

He sends a text to Choro, leaving an address and informing his brother that he might have found a lead while on route to the facility.

It’s a nice place, he thinks to himself.

“Excuse me. You haven’t seen my brother recently, have you? He went missing about three months ago.”

The secretary nearly jumps in her seat when she sees Karamatsu. At first she thinks it's the NEET she sold off so many months ago, but when he mentions his brother things start to click into place.

"Your brother?" She purses her lips, tapping her pen on the desk. "Oh, right! He's been given an internship as a part of a job offer. He's doing very well, we're sorry we couldn't contact his family in that time. Would you like to see where he's working in the building? He talks about you sometimes."

Kara frowns a bit, trying to work through if what she said made sense. Why wouldn’t Oso come home after being given an internship? The facility was within walking distance of their home, he didn’t need to work himself to the bone.

“Sure. Do you know if he started renting an apartment or something? It seems strange that he wouldn’t come home. Everyone’s been really worried about him.”

The secretary nods, formulating a story on the spot.

"Oh, yes!" She offers a smile as she stands up from the desk, motioning Kara to a long hallway. "He's been very busy, so he's only had time to work. Rest assured that he has housing and he's receiving care."

The door she opens reveals a similar room to the one Oso was confined in, dimly lit and small enough to fit two or three people. In the room is a table with a few objects on top - a roll of tape, a dildo, a vibrator, and a full-body latex suit.

"Oh, looks like your brother is on a short break," she says, a sadistic smile on her face as she grips onto Kara's arms. "In the meantime, let's relax together before he comes back."

“Well that doesn’t sound too bad I guess. Sort of inconsiderate of him. But that’s on him, not you,” he smiles, following her into the room. She seemed nice enough. Definitely too nice to be interested in Oso or even give him the time of day. 

The facility might have been useful to Kara to get a job like his older brother but he saw much more interest in trying to ask her out on a date.

“His loss.” Kara commented dryly, glancing at the secretary and grinning. “Guess it’s just the two of us, huh? I’d like it if we did a little more than...relax.”
